content:
The settings in calender are set to windows .. it does the same if I set it to Austalia/Perth

However, if I use another timezone, eg Australia/Melbourne .. it works perfectly .. I put an event in and it appears at the correct time in SOGO, etc .. and if I change the timezone back to windows or Perth in the calendar settings, the event is correct.

It seems to be purely when creating a new event based on the Australia/Perth timezone :(
creator: mal8

content: Thunderbird cannot block messages, but can filter them from your view. To do that, create a filter that selects on content that is in the messages. From your post, it appears you could set the FROM to CONTAINS and enter text that is always present. To fully remove this sender, I suggest investigating to see if your email account online has a filter or spam control tool that would completely eliminate the messages.
creator: davidsk

content:
Just my thoughts: - I would do IMAP (although POP could work and both have similar exposure to any interruption) - check that account settings>synchronization&storage is set for offline use - set File>offline>download to ensure all headers and messages are retrieved - once you have all messages downloaded, I would create filters to separate messages into smaller groups, in Local Folders. 

   My reasoning is that Thunderbird could choke, trying to manage 22g of mail in one folder (just my opinion)

- once done, check that all messages are accounted for and then delete the IMAP account. - finally, exit thunderbird and do two backups of the profile folder with WIndows File Explorer

AND, I suggest waiting for other suggestions, as there may be other possibilities in this.
creator: davidsk

content:
Informazioni utili da fornire nelle richieste al forum:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
creator: @next

content:
Beste Raf,

wij bieden ondersteuning voor Mozilla-toepassingen en kunnen helaas niet helpen bij het herstellen van uw wachtwoord voor uw e-mailprovider.

Als het goed is kunt u zelf uw wachtwoord opnieuw instellen. Voor Skynet.be gaat dat via https://www.proximus.be/login/nl/webmail.html. Zie ook https://nl.forum.proximus.be/internet-10/skynet-wachtwoord-vergeten-mailbox-onbereikbaar-60591.
creator: markh2

content: Overigens kan plots vragen om een wachtwoord betekenen dat de serverinstellingen in Thunderbird niet juist staan. Volg de stappen in https://www.proximus.be/support/nl/id_sfaqr_mail_config/particulieren/support/internet/e-mails-en-website/je-mailbox-instellen/email-instellen-op-je-gsm-tablet-of-computer.html om na te gaan of dit zo is en pas de instellingen zonodig aan.
creator: markh2

content: The upper entries are the unified folder view, showing all folders that are common among the accounts. The entries below are the folders that are unique to the various accounts.
creator: davidsk

content:
Thanks David The weird thing is that sub folders of an email account - sometimes move down to the correspsonding folder below (the ones that are unique to the various accounts)

So when you go to look in the unified entries - some of them have moved and at first you think they have been deleted.

I'm just wondering how I can stop it doing that, Many thanks Jonathan
creator: jono4

content: Your contact list is secure, no changes needed. The addressbook is independent from email accounts.
